app.title: - AI-Powered Image to Confluence Page -
app.description: Upload an image. AI analyze. Automatically create a new Confluence page.

upload.title: Step 1: Upload Image
upload.description: Select an image file to upload.
upload.content:
Click to select image or drag file here
Supports BMP, JPG and PNG

analyze.title: Step 2: Analyzing...
analyze.description: AI is analyzing your images and generating content...
analyze.content:
Analyzing images, please waiting...
This may take a few seconds

edit.title: Step 3: Review and Create Page
edit.description: Review and edit the content before creating the page.

successfully.title: Successfully!
successfully.content: This image conversion page has been successfully completed. Confluence page has been created. The relevant data has been saved to history

history.title: User History
history.description: Clicking a record can delete or create the page based on that record.
history.empty: There is no history yet. Try uploading a picture!
history.confirmDeleteAllContent: This operation will permanently delete all history and cannot be recovered.
history.confirmDeleteSingleTitle: Are you sure to delete this record?
history.confirmDeleteSingleContent: This operation will permanently delete this history and cannot be restored.

toolbar.title: Toolbar
toolbar.description: Here can modify detailed, such as vision, AI and text style.
toolbar.disabled: The toolbar cannot be modified during image analysis
toolbar.auto_clear: If the page is created successfully, the history will be automatically cleared

help.title: Help
help.intro: Welcome to AIwhiteboard â€“ a smart tool to turn whiteboard images into organized Confluence content.

sections.title: App Introduction
sections.content:
This app will send your uploaded images to external AI services and analyze them according to your settings, generate text, and conveniently publish them as Confluence pages with one click.
Currently, our models include GPT and Gemini. Regarding user privacy, we only need to collect your Atlassian ID. Additionally, you can freely delete your uploaded image data.

content.title: 1. Upload an Image
content.description: Click the upload box or drag an image into it. Supported formats: JPG, PNG, BMP.

content.title: 2. Automatic AI Analysis
content.description: Once uploaded, the image is automatically analyzed. AI extracts key information.

content.title: 3. Generate Confluence Page
content.description: The extracted content is used to automatically create a new Confluence page.

content.title: 4. Customize Your Experience
content.description: You can change the theme and switch interface language at any time.

content.title: 5. History Records
content.description: Find all your previously generated results in the history. You can conveniently restore, regenerate, or delete records at any time.

sections.title: Development Team
sections.content:
We are:

Thank you for using this app!

tips.regenerateTip: Let AI analyze this image again with current parameters

steps.title: Upload Your Image
steps.content: This is the upload area. Click here or drag and drop your whiteboard image to get started. We support JPG, PNG, and BMP formats.

steps.title: View History
steps.content: Click this button to view your previous analysis results. You can restore, regenerate, or delete any historical record.

steps.title: Choose AI Model
steps.content: Select which AI model to use for analysis. Different models may provide different analysis styles and accuracy levels.

steps.title: Select Prompt Type
steps.content: Choose the type of analysis you want. Different prompt types will extract different kinds of information from your image.

steps.title: Custom Prompt
steps.content: Enter your own custom instructions here to tell the AI exactly what you want to extract or focus on in the image.

steps.title: Edit Mode
steps.content: Toggle this to enable edit mode, allowing you to modify the AI-generated content before creating your Confluence page.

steps.title: Auto Clear
steps.content: When enabled, this will automatically clear the results after successfully creating a Confluence page, preparing for your next upload.

steps.title: Reset Settings
steps.content: Click this button to reset all settings back to their default values if you want to start fresh.
